alert.note: Alert for W Mendocino NF, E Mendocino Unit (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 29 at 9:03AM PDT until August 30 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...STRONG NORTH WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES WILL YIELD CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS ACROSS EASTERN LAKE COUNTY DURING WEDNESDAY... .North winds gusting from 25 to 35 mph across exposed ridges and terrain will develop across eastern Lake County during Wednesday morning. Winds will weaken slightly going into Wednesday afternoon, but relative humidity values will fall into the teens during the warmest hours of the day. The end result will be a critical fire weather event occurring across eastern Lake County from late Tuesday evening through early Wednesday evening. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 PM PDT WEDNESDAY... The National Weather Service in Eureka has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 11 PM this evening to 8 PM PDT Wednesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * WIND...North winds gusting from 25 to 35 mph across exposed ridges and terrain. Strongest winds Wednesday morning. * HUMIDITY...Relative humidity values falling into the teens during Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: W Mendocino NF, E Mendocino Unit
